Washington's inability to come to a debt
limit agreement has many Americans
asking
how did we get here Louise story looks
back for weeks we've been hearing about
the political debate in Washington over
the nation's debt limit but before this
many Americans may never have known that
our nation had a borrowing limit
Congress introduced it in 1917 to
address some concerns over the nation's
borrowing to pay for World War one
before that Congress had to vote on
exactly how much it would spend and what
it would spend it on each time when they
introduced the debt limit congress also
gave the Treasury Department more
freedom on how it's spent borrowed money
and they expanded that free rein in the
1930s but the debt limit has not exactly
rained the country in because since then
Congress has increased it 102 times and
in the last decade it's been raised 10
times just back in 2002 it was six point
four trillion dollars now it's fourteen
point three trillion and they're
debating raising it a lot higher
potentially up to 16 trillion you might

the positive side of having countries
